attributes.action: Retake control of the Bank England and force significant Base rate reduction
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The UK economy is in melt down -manufacturing order books are in free fall and we are facing the risk of rapidly growing unemployment and economic misery

During 2008 the Bank of England Monetary policy committee has been over cautious and over focused on its goal of control of inflation within the 2% target

Political leaders are accountable for the economic well being of the British nation and politicians should control monetary policy, as they will have to answer to the electorate for economic outcomes. Politicians can not and should not delegate this Fundamental responsibility to an "independent body"

The creation of an independent Bank of England was a good experiment. But now the government should have the courage and strength to admit that it has not worked and must regain control of monetary policy 

The UK government need to act quickly to prevent dire economic consequences for the British people
